ranked_diseases.explanation: The combination of cortical thickening of long bones, elevated alkaline phosphatase, bone pain, waddling gait, and hyperostosis are classic features of Camurati-Engelmann disease.
This condition is characterized by hyperostosis and elevated alkaline phosphatase, similar to features in the patient. Similar reference cases were diagnosed with this disease.
Though primarily characterized by intellectual disability, this condition features elevated alkaline phosphatase and has some skeletal abnormalities overlapping with the patient's symptoms.
